body_html:
@yaroslavvb I upload a part of my dataset here.
20161230_part-00390.output.pb.zlib.zip

  1. increase queue size to fit the entire dataset
    the "queue size " you mentioned is capacity in tf.train.shuffle_batch() ?
    in my script, capacity = thread_number * batch_size + min_after_dequeue, I tried increase min_after_dequeue or batchsize to a large value but it didn't help.
  2. print(sess.run(queue.size())) how to get queue variable in my script?
body_text:
@yaroslavvb    I upload a part of my dataset here.

increase queue size to fit the entire dataset
the "queue size " you mentioned is capacity in tf.train.shuffle_batch() ?
in my script, capacity = thread_number * batch_size + min_after_dequeue, I tried increase min_after_dequeue or batchsize to a large value but it didn't help.
print(sess.run(queue.size()))   how to get queue variable in my script?
body:
@yaroslavvb    I upload a part of my dataset here.
[20161230_part-00390.output.pb.zlib.zip](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/files/706423/20161230_part-00390.output.pb.zlib.zip)

1) increase queue size to fit the entire dataset
the "queue size " you mentioned is `capacity` in `tf.train.shuffle_batch()` ?
in my script, `capacity = thread_number * batch_size + min_after_dequeue`, I tried increase min_after_dequeue or batchsize to a large value but it didn't help.
2) `print(sess.run(queue.size()))`   how to get queue variable in my script?
